title: [Requirements] Pillow Version Issue (`Image.Resampling.BILINEAR`)
body:
### Checklist

- [X] I have searched the [existing issues](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/issues) for similar issues.
- [X] I added a very descriptive title to this issue.
- [X] I have provided sufficient information below to help reproduce this issue.

### Summary

In the Streamlit, the code ([this line](https://github.com/streamlit/streamlit/blob/b3e4ee6c14bc992790ad084acd07e7dbc4412a61/lib/streamlit/elements/image.py#L300)) uses `Image.Resampling.BILINEAR`, which is only available in `PIL` versions `>=9.1.0`. Here are the results of testing with different versions of Pillow:

```python
$ pip install pillow==9.0.0
>>> from PIL import Image
>>> Image.Resampling.BILINEAR
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/agilesoda/anaconda3/lib/python3.9/site-packages/PIL/Image.py", line 65, in __getattr__
    raise AttributeError(f"module '{__name__}' has no attribute '{name}'")
AttributeError: module 'PIL.Image' has no attribute 'Resampling'

$ pip install pillow==9.1.0
>>> from PIL import Image
>>> Image.Resampling.
Image.Resampling.BICUBIC   Image.Resampling.BOX       Image.Resampling.LANCZOS   Image.Resampling.mro(      
Image.Resampling.BILINEAR  Image.Resampling.HAMMING   Image.Resampling.NEAREST   
>>> Image.Resampling.BILINEAR
<Resampling.BILINEAR: 2>
```

Based on this, it appears that the Pillow requirement in the [Streamlit requirements](https://github.com/Zerohertz/streamlit-contrib/commit/deca3bd4dd6d43b21adb9ab965a6542c79e1a28a) should be updated to reflect the correct minimum version.
Should I submit a pull request to update this?

### Reproducible Code Example

_No response_

_No response_

_No response_

### Current Behavior

_No response_

### Is this a regression?

- [ ] Yes, this used to work in a previous version.
